titles.title: To amend the National Security Act of 1947 to prohibit persons who disclose classified information from holding a security clearance for access to such information.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.

bill.summary: 7/14/2005--Introduced. Amends the National Security Act of 1947 to provide for the revocation of the security clearance of any federal employee who discloses, or has disclosed, classified information, including the identity of a covert agent of the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA).
